intro: Correa lawrenciana var. grampiana, commonly known as the Grampian correa, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, urn-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, and features narrow, dark green leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for gardens in temperate climates. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its prolonged flowering period, which can last several months.
